content.description:
Start on the far right of the East face. Climb up pulling the bulge and thin face higher up. A harder variation starts just a few feet left and traverses right into the bulge.               

The Pinnacle
content.location: Purple route on the beta photo.

content.description: Sit start in jug slot under the roof. Move out right through decent finger jugs and up to finish. Can walk off to right.
content.location: Under small roof of the Pinnacle face.

content.description:
Start at the left edge or the wall on a small block.  Work up the rib toward the top.  Spot the climber so a fall from the start doesn’t allow them to pendulum into the rocky hill.

The Pinnacle East Face:  Pink - Lichen Rain, Green - Boogie Woogie Jam, Purple - Three Minutes of Heavy Breathing
content.location: The Pink route on the Beta photo.

content.description: Climb up the face  between Boogie Woogie Jam and Lichen Rain on good but strenuous edges aiming for the top center apex formed by a 10" wide ledge and then finish on Boogie Woogie Jam.
content.protection: Top System requires gear placements 3 inch to 3/4 inch cams and a 2 inch diameter tree to back it up.  See the main Area page "The Pinnacle Climbing" for more info on setting up and breaking down the top-system on this free standing Pinnacle.
content.location: Start in the center of the face between Boogie Woogie Jam and Lichen Rain.

content.description: Stand start in crimp seam. Finishes straight up.
content.location: Boulder just right of the Pinnacle Face.

content.description: Start at the center of the wall on a shallow inside corner. Follow the crack to the top.  The slightly overhanging start gives it a pumpy quality.
content.protection: Tree and gear placements. Trad: nothing larger than 1" on the route, larger stuff for the anchor.
content.location: The Green route on the Beta photo.

content.description:
The Pinnacle is the largest wall of the outcrops on the left end of the TWS outcrops. The East wall has 2 fantastic climbs in the 5.8-5.9 range. The wall overhangs but has good holds. There just aren’t many good rests so it’s pumpy. The Pinnacle does have a set up difficulty. It truly is free standing, about 4 feet below and in front of the hillside wall. Jump the gap to the top of the pinnacle. An exposed but short easy scramble can also be used from the back west corner to the top. Anchors are a small tree and gear. To get the top system down, finish one of the climbs to the top. Lower one end of the rope down the low angle west side and have someone secure the other end of the rope to a tree on the opposite side. Rappel the west side. Pull the rope back over the top.               

The Pinnacle East Face:  Pink - Lichen Rain, Green - Boogie Woogie Jam, Purple - Three Minutes of Heavy Breathing
